discussion.content: 443 is HTTPS. It must remain open so that the server can continue to host the secure website.

questions.question_text: A security administrator ran a port scanning tool against a virtual server that is hosting a secure website. A list of open ports was provided as documentation. The management team has requested that non-essential ports be disabled on the firewall. Which of the following ports must remain open?

A server is performing slowly, and users are reporting issues connecting to the application on that server. Upon investigation, the server administrator notices several unauthorized services running on that server that are successfully communicating to an external site. Which of the following are MOST likely causing the issue? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The firewall rule for the server is misconfigured
choices.C: The server is infected with a virus
choices.E: Unnecessary services are disabled on the server
choices.A: Adware is installed on the users' devices
choices.F: SELinux is enabled on the server
choices.D: Intrusion detection is enabled on the network

discussion.content: IRL applications, I'd say more on B and C. Can't say adware for sure. Malware yes. but I would point more toward spyware if anything

Selected Answer: BC
To me, this seems like a clear case of C&C (command and control) someone hacked into the server, and it is now calling home. The hacker may have changed firewall rules to allow the server to call home, or they have have been unsecure to begin with. The problem is not the users computers having adware, the server is what is running slow, causing a denial of availability for the users. Server has malware. and server is calling home, a clear B & C for me. Have gotten Pentest+ Cysa+ Security+ Network+, most of the answers in these questions (by the community) are pretty bad. study this stuff for yourself, don't depend on the answers in the discussions. Just my opinion.

Selected Answer: BC
B&C are correct. "TheITStudent" explanation is right on.

Selected Answer: BC
"A server is performing slowly, ... several unauthorized services running on that server that are successfully communicating to an external site." End user issues are a by product of the server issues. 
I agree with TheITStudent's explanation with C&C

Another Keyword CompTIA trick.. MOST like cause of the issue:

Adware is a type of malware, so if you choosing a virus as the possible cause you might as well choose adware as another possible cause, before misconfigured firewall.

why would firewall rules change? how is E the problem? harding is done before productions, so you have to re-harden your services... what if you shutdown the service to that application?
Why not check first to make sure workstations aren't infected with malware/adaware that could infect the server or spread through the network or to other users??..... Why is the server responding slowly and has external unknow communication..? Maybe workstations communicating with external port/application??

I like provided answers.

Selected Answer: BC
I would say B and C
Adware on the users' machine is a large assumption. If everyone is affected it's unlikely that everyone has adware, and more likely that the server has a virus slowing it down.
The server most likely got the virus from open ports i.e. misconfigured firewall.

comments.content:
C yes.
E. Unnecessary services are disabled on the server
Unnecessary - disabled

questions.question_text: A systems engineer is configuring a new VLAN for expansion of a campus network. The engineer configures a new DHCP scope on the existing Windows DHCP server cluster and activates the scope for the clients. However, new clients in the area report they are not receiving any DHCP address information. Which of the following should the engineer do first?

choices.A: Confirm the client PCs are using the correct speed on the NIC.
choices.C: Confirm the network has a helper address for the DHCP server.
choices.D: Confirm the DHCP server is authorized in Active Directory.
choices.B: Confirm the network uses the same NTP server as the clients.

discussion.content:
C. Confirm the network has a helper address for the DHCP server.

A helper address (also known as IP Helper) is required when DHCP requests need to be forwarded across different network segments or VLANs. Configuring a helper address on routers or layer 3 switches allows DHCP messages to be relayed to the DHCP server located in a different subnet. Therefore, ensuring that the network has a helper address configured for the DHCP server is the first step in troubleshooting DHCP address assignment issues across VLANs.
It should be B, very few server deployments use DHCP. If they want that to be the answer they would need to specify the servers receive their IPs via DHCP since that is an atypical setup.

Selected Answer: B
B. IPv4 options

Checking the IPv4 options involves ensuring the server is correctly configured to communicate on the network, including having a valid IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway. These settings can be assigned manually or obtained automatically through DHCP. If these settings are not correctly configured, the server will not be able to communicate on the network, even if the physical connection (network cable) is functioning correctly.

questions.question_text: After installing an OS on a new server, the administrator realizes the server does not have any network connectivity. The administrator checks the network cable, and it seems to be transferring data. Which of the following should be checked next?

choices.A: Reboot to the RAID controller BIOS and rescan for attached disks and arrays.
choices.B: Start the motherboard UEFI and confirm the RAID controller start order is correct.
choices.D: Turn off all components and confirm all external and internal cables before rebooting.
choices.C: Turn off the external arrays and reboot the server to redetect the internal disks first.

questions.question_text: A technician needs to replace two RAID controllers on a database server as part of an upgrade. The server has six external storage arrays and eight internal disks that are controlled by the two RAID controllers. The technician completes the replacement and powers the systems back on, but the server OS detects several missing disks in the configuration. Which of the following steps should the technician take first to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. appears to be the most correct and the option actually addressing the one potential mis-match in installing new hardware.
Everything else describes checking equipment that was either working just fine before the hardware upgrade (that wasn't touched) or was never changed before or after the upgrade.

Selected Answer: A
Checking every single cable is time intensive and may be unnecessary. A is going to be the fastest option to see what drives aren't connected, and if the issue is between the Drives and the RAID controller, which is what D is "fixing" or if the issue is between the RAID controller and the OS.
